title: Sen. Dianne Feinstein says she won't run for reelection in 2024
description: Sen. Dianne Feinstein, D-Calif., the oldest sitting member of Congress, said she will accomplish as much as possible before she steps down.

title: After a big recovery, the wood stork may soon fly off the endangered species list
description: The ungainly yet graceful wood stork, which was on the brink of extinction in 1984, has rebounded dramatically in Florida and other Southern states, officials say.

title: Apparently, love does have a price. It's $25.9 billion
description: Americans celebrating Valentine's Day are expected to spend an average of $192.80 each this year. That's, like, 11 boxes of fun dip packages.

title: Senators talk about upping online safety for kids. This year they could do something
description: During a Senate Judiciary Committee hearing, lawmakers blasted tech companies that they said do little to keep kids safe from bullying, addiction and "rabbit holes of dangerous material."

title: Barney the purple dinosaur is coming back with a new show — and a new look
description: Barney, the big purple dinosaur with a preschool following, will be returning to TV in 2024 with a new animated series, according to Mattel. A new film, toys and adult apparel are also in the works.

title: Senators downplay threats from unidentified objects, but call for more information
description: Many Democrats defended the Biden administration's cautious approach. But lawmakers of both parties urged the president to address the nation.

title: A Valentine's Day message from Banksy comments on violence against women
description: The work depicts a woman who appears to be missing a tooth and whose eye is swollen shut. Shortly after it appeared in England, parts of the graffiti installation were dismantled by local officials.

title: European allies condemn Israel's plan to build more housing units in the West Bank
description: France, Germany, Italy and the United Kingdom joined the U.S. in condemning Israel's plans to build 10,000 more housing units in existing settlements in the occupied West Bank.

title: Timeline: How a Chinese 'spy balloon' prompted the U.S. to scour the skies
description: The U.S. and China have traded fiery allegations of extensive aerial surveillance programs since the U.S. shot down a Chinese balloon on Feb. 4. Here's a look at what's happened so far.

title: Russia deports thousands of Ukrainian children. Investigators say that's a war crime
description: A team at Yale University is using open-source materials to document the forced removal of Ukrainian children to Russia. Russia says it's a vast humanitarian program.

title: A United Airlines flight took a steep dive to just 800 feet above the Pacific Ocean
description: The airline says the two pilots of the December flight from Maui made a safety report after landing in San Francisco and are currently receiving additional training.

title: As its ambitions soar, Air India orders 470 Boeing and Airbus aircraft
description: India's second-largest domestic carrier placed orders for 220 Boeing aircraft valued at $34 billion and 250 Airbus planes in a separate deal that could be worth tens of billions of dollars.

title: The U.S. military lifts the Chinese balloon's 'priority sensors' from the ocean floor
description: "Crews have been able to recover significant debris from the site, including all of the priority sensor and electronics pieces identified," U.S. Northern Command said.

title: Inflation eased again in January – but there's a cautionary sign
description: Annual inflation cooled in January for the seventh month in a row. But price increases accelerated between December and January, fueled by rising shelter, food and gasoline prices.

title: Indian tax authorities raid BBC, weeks after it airs documentary critical of Modi
description: A two-part BBC documentary examined Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi's role in anti-Muslim raids that killed hundreds in his home state of Gujarat in 2002.

title: Despite Khamenei's amnesty, most protesters in Iran won't go free, advocate says
description: Iran has jailed up to 20,000 people in months of protests against the regime. The announcement that it's pardoning prisoners is an empty gesture, a human rights lawyer says.

title: High-paying jobs that don't need a college degree? Thousands of them are sitting empty
description: Trade jobs that require less education, at much lower cost, sit empty. But many parents remain wary of programs that don't lead to a four-year degree.

title: After Turkey's quake, one family mourns its losses — and braces for more
description: As volunteers continue digging through the rubble of a collapsed apartment building, the siblings of a woman found dead with her four children are now awaiting news of their mother and another sister.

title: Where Greta Thunberg does (and doesn't) expect to see action on climate change
description: Greta Thunberg says she has no plans to get into politics as a career, and she thinks she can do more as a climate campaigner on the outside.

title: Lasers, robots, and tiny electrodes are transforming treatment of severe epilepsy
description: For people with drug-resistant epilepsy, surgery used to be seen as a last resort. Now it's often the treatment of choice.

title: Health concerns grow in East Palestine, Ohio, after train derailment
description: Air monitoring continues in East Palestine after the crews released a number of toxic chemicals in what officials called a "controlled explosion" last week.

title: More than half of Republicans support Christian nationalism according to a new survey
description: Christian nationalism has been seen as outside the mainstream. But new data from the Public Religion Research Institute and the Brookings Institute indicates it's more common than many think.

title: Nearly $50,000 a week for a cancer drug? A man worries about bankrupting his family
description: Medicare suddenly stopped paying for the pricey drug that prolongs his life. As he waits for an appeal, this retired physician wonders if he should give up treatment to spare his family the cost.

title: He was the head of Mexico's FBI. Now he's on trial for accepting cartel bribes
description: Guilty or innocent, the drug-corruption trial in New York of  high-ranking former Mexican government official, Genaro Garcia Luna, shows the limits of the U.S. to win its decades-long "war on drugs."

title: Multiple people are injured in a shooting at Michigan State University, police say
description: Police say shootings have been reported in multiple locations and say there is one suspect.
